item.title: High street Harrow Road, 6th October
item.description:
Over flown bins taking up the pavement. Loads of household goods like mattresses. Nappies and soiled things all over the floor. It is disgraceful that the streets are left like this! It smells and itâ€™s disgusting This has been like this since last week and every time I drive past this road I see it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dyne Road, London

item.title: Litter on Tabard street, 6th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pardoner Street, Walworth, London

item.title: Tables and chairs with pavement rope off, 6th October
item.description:
I have reported this issue of pavement problems at this address three times. Last report no 8234846 this premises does not have a pavement license. The pavement In narrow outside this restaurant and they make it much narrower with tables and chairs which are then create a roped of area. Neighbours who have mobility scooters, people with children and prams have trouble navigating the pavement especially in busy times of day. It is stated that no problem was found in the report which is incorrect. The restaurant is open from 12 noon till late so no obstruction till then. I suggest you check the premises and pavement in busy times. I hope you now address this issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, High Street, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Low bridge sign fronting 10, Shortlands Rd, Shortlands (nr jct Mays Hill Rd) has rotated nearly 80 degrees so is no longer facing oncoming traffic., 6th October
item.description:
Low bridge sign fronting 10, Shortlands Rd, Shortlands (nr jct Mays Hill Rd) has rotated nearly 80 degrees so is no longer facing oncoming traffic. It has rotated even more since this photo about 4 days ago. For about the 5th time in 3 years, please find a permanent solution. Eg. drill a pair of bolts through the sign into the pole. Whateveter is there now, eg. jubilee clips, are not holding the large sign in place on the single pole.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shortlands Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
